talk.author: did:plc:h4f4qdtqobfrfl66qouho5lo
talk.utter: The fact that everyone assumes the people who voted for him know as much about his policies as the very online people talking about them is sort of a problem.

talk.author: did:plc:muaggdpoomfuu4n34g4z44ix
talk.utter: Every single person had access to the information. It was on TV, in print and online media, on the news every single night. Anyone who claims they didn‚Äôt know is willfully ignorant and that in and of itself is a choice also undeserving of empathy

talk.author: did:plc:h4f4qdtqobfrfl66qouho5lo
talk.utter: I think you need to talk to some people who are completely detached from politics, because you don't understand their lives at all.

talk.author: did:plc:h4f4qdtqobfrfl66qouho5lo
talk.utter: Not enough people know about the opium wars or how the East India Company made so, so much money for Britain and the aristocracy.

talk.author: did:plc:o3o4uv5qav4zqvstn4rov27e
talk.utter: I wasn't taught about the opium wars in school it was pretty mind blowing reading about it for the first time.

talk.author: did:plc:h4f4qdtqobfrfl66qouho5lo
talk.utter: ditto, I didn't really learn much about colonization in places other than here (where it was, of course, good).

talk.author: did:plc:h4f4qdtqobfrfl66qouho5lo
talk.utter: But when we built cities we built them around those values, and trying to change cities to make them healthier to live in goes up against a value system.

talk.author: did:plc:dzwlkfkhiixxvfsldyjpycrg
talk.utter:
Sure! Maybe?

I grew up in a tiny town in the redwoods of Northern California.

People in "cities" whose parents aren't "preppers" embody "a value system" that's interesting and beautiful! ‚ù§Ô∏è

I don't insist that others get trailers in the woods and eat rabbits and vegetables. Live and let live! üññ

talk.author: did:plc:h4f4qdtqobfrfl66qouho5lo
talk.utter:
I grew up in a tiny town in ranching country in california.  I live in the city now (LA area).  And I've been to other cities.  (New York, Tokyo, Seoul, Nagoya, DC, Houston, Seattle).  

LA specifically was built around cars while NY has subways but doesn't maintain them.  Tokyo has good subways.

talk.author: did:plc:h4f4qdtqobfrfl66qouho5lo
talk.utter:
My daughter lived in Seoul for 2 years.  The way Seoul and Tokyo are organized around community spaces vs individual spaces is just so different, and it's super interesting.  But their societies always placed community ahead of individualism.  

It's just a very different way to organize cities.

talk.author: did:plc:h4f4qdtqobfrfl66qouho5lo
talk.utter: And if you visit Seoul or Tokyo one of the first things you'll notice is that you can get fresh, good food within walking distance almost anywhere in the city.
